original_solution_mapping.L1: Randy has 30-10=<<30-10=20>>20 dollars left after buying lunch.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Randy spent 20/4=<<20/4=5>>5 dollars on the ice cream cone.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 843.
    Returns: the amount of money Randy has left.
    """
    # L1
    initial_money = 30 # Randy has $30
    lunch_cost = 10 # spent $10 buying his lunch
    money_after_lunch = initial_money - lunch_cost

    # L2
    quarter_divisor = 4 # a quarter of the money
    ice_cream_cost = money_after_lunch / quarter_divisor

    # L3
    money_left = money_after_lunch - ice_cream_cost

    # FA
    answer = money_left
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Randy has {initial_money}-{lunch_cost}=<<{initial_money}-{lunch_cost}={money_after_lunch}>>{money_after_lunch} dollars left after buying lunch.
Randy spent {money_after_lunch}/{quarter_divisor}=<<{money_after_lunch}/{quarter_divisor}={ice_cream_cost}>>{ice_cream_cost} dollars on the ice cream cone.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Randy has 30-10=<<30-10=40>>40 dollars left after buying lunch.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Randy spent 40/4=<<40/4=10>>10 dollars on the ice cream cone.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '-' but used '+' instead.
